meanings.definition: Capable of being resumed or continued after an interruption.
meanings.sent1: The movie had a resumable plot, making it easy to follow even after pausing.
meanings.sent2: The resumable download feature allowed users to pause and resume large file transfers.
meanings.sent3: The resumable game level paused just before the final boss, leaving players in suspense.
meanings.sent4: Her resumable energy seemed endless, like a never-ending battery.
meanings.sent5: The resumable nature of the conversation made it feel like a continuous flow of ideas.

meanings.definition: Able to be picked up again at a later time.
meanings.sent1: The resumable book was perfect for reading a few pages before bed each night.
meanings.sent2: The resumable task could be easily continued after lunch without losing progress.
meanings.sent3: His resumable interest in painting led to a collection of half-finished canvases.
meanings.sent4: The resumable melody played softly in the background, waiting for the singer to return.
meanings.sent5: The resumable nature of the project allowed for flexibility in scheduling.

meanings.sent1: The resumable computer program could be restarted without losing any data.
meanings.sent2: The resumable meeting could be recommenced after the unexpected power outage.
meanings.sent3: The resumable recipe paused at the marinating step, ready to be continued later.
meanings.sent4: His resumable determination to finish the race inspired others to keep going.
meanings.sent5: The resumable journey through the forest felt like a series of interconnected paths.
